definition: at the knee (in reference to children)/(salutation used in letters to parents or grandparents)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
lit. the man has gold under his knees; fig. a man who does not easily kneel in front of others (owing to pride or moral integrity)
pinyin: nan2 ren2 xi1 xia4 you3 huang2 jin1

sentences.english: He reportedly had three sons and two daughters.
sentences.chinese: 據報導，溥任膝下有三子二女。

sentences.english: It is a pat ern of thinking learned at our mothers! knees.
sentences.chinese: 這是在母親膝下就已形成的思維模式。

sentences.english: She bent at the knee when she skied downhill.
sentences.chinese: 她滑雪下山時曲膝下蹲。

sentences.english: When the flies, their knee, the sharing of family happiness.
sentences.chinese: 時如梭，兒孫齊膝下，共享天倫樂。

sentences.english: Long ago, an aging childless king gathered his court together.
sentences.chinese: 很久很久以前，有一位年老的國王，膝下無子。

sentences.english: Softly touch your knee to the floor when stepping back into the half-kneeling position.
sentences.chinese: 向後撤步至單膝下跪姿態時，膝部應和地面輕輕接觸。

sentences.english: Two patients underwent a secondary below-knee amputation half a year later for the reason of intractable pain.
sentences.chinese: 兩位病患在半年後因疼痛而接受膝下截肢。

sentences.english: His overcoat reaches just below his knees.
The mire now reached to his knees, and the water to his waist.
sentences.chinese: 現在淤泥已到膝下，而水則到了腰際。

sentences.english: The blood supply of proximal fibular epiphysis pedicled only with lateral inferior genicular artery was enough.
sentences.chinese: 以膝下外動脈爲蒂的腓骨頭骨骺移植，血供豐富。

sentences.english: A lathy white scar below my left knee could date back to almost twenty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 左膝下方淺白細長的傷痕，是約二十年前留下的。

definition: (children) run around parent's knees/fig. to stay to look after one's elderly parents
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to get married and start a career (idiom)/to settle down/to establish oneself
